incidents.name: Webhook Callbacks Degraded

incident_updates.body: Twilio callback service is degraded and customers may experience failed webhook callbacks for a small portion of their traffic. Our engineering team is currently investigating the root cause of the issue. We will provide another update in 1 hour or as soon as more information becomes available.

incidents.name: Callback Failures That are Affecting Voice Calls and Video Customers

incident_updates.body: Twilio callback-service was degraded for 43 minutes between 03:18 and 04:01 Pacific Time on 03/11/2025. During this period of time customers may have experienced failed webhook callbacks for a small percentage (<1%) of their calls or videos. The issue has now been mitigated, while the team continues root cause investigation.

incidents.name: Callback Failures That Are Affecting  Voice Calls and Video Customer

incident_updates.body: We are no longer seeing service degradation with Voice and Video. The incident has been resolved.

Twilio Engineering has isolated the problem which caused a service degradation with Voice and Video. Twilio engineers are seeing improvement and will monitor for full recovery. We will provide another update in 2 hours or as soon as more information becomes available.

Programmable Voice and Video customers are seeing an elevated level of 500 errors in status-callbacks. Twilio Engineers are investigating the problem. We expect to provide another update in 1 hour or as soon as more information becomes available.

incidents.name: Console not Taking Account Upgrade After Being Completed

incident_updates.body: Our engineers have identified an issue with the upgrade flow in Console where customers still see the "Upgrade" button available after completing the upgrade of the account and are working to deploy a fix. As a workaround, customers can do a hard refresh in the browser and then the console will reflect the upgraded state. We expect to provide another update in 24 hours or as soon as more information becomes available.
